BOTELHO, LUIZ C.;BOTELHO, LUIZ C.L.;LUIZ C L BOTELHO;Luiz C L Botelho;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ C.Â L.;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ C.Â L.;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ C.L.;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ C.L.;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ L.Â C.;BOTELHO, LUIZÂ L.Â C.;L., C.;BOTELHO, LUIZ CL;BOTELHO LCL;BOTELHO, LUIS C L;BOTHELHO , L .C.L;BOTELHO, L C L

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: O presente autor (Nascido em 01-03-1960 ,Be-Pa ) tem desenvolvido pesquisas ao longo dos últimos 40 anos em 1- Física Matemática ,com ênfase nos formalismos matemáticos da Física Quântica -Teoria quântica dos Campos , 2- em Matemática Física (Análise Funcional -Teoria matemática da Integração de Funcionais e finalmente em 3-Engenharia Matemática Avançada (Física -Matemática Técnica ) , com ênfase em métodos de integração Funcional para Problemas de propagação e difusão em meios aleatórios (Meios e Turbulência Estatísticos- veja a coletânea dos nossos artigos no tema https://www.amazon.com/Methods-Bosonic-Path-Integrals-Representations/dp/1594540195?fbclid=IwAR2YrjTGRUTy_4NDODYgnbP0DvEfsGrPDWGMeBIqIv8q1UMEiJka63zx6qo ), conforme pode-se constatar dos seus artigos e livros de Pesquisas elencados neste CV Lattes .Também ressaltamos como eventos importantes na carreira do Pesquisador , o seu Doutoramento em 1985-CBPF e sem orientação acadêmica e com a idade de 24 anos, 2- De ter cursado disciplinas de nivelamento ao programa de Mestrado em matemática do IM-UFRJ , ainda no segundo grau e com a idade de 15 anos e 3- O fato de que todos os seus trabalhos são de sua única autoria e lavra , portanto não tendo tido co-autores ou alunos de Pós Graduação durante a sua carreira científica . Aposentou-se da carreira de Magistério superior do serviço público federal -UFF-RJ , em Março de 2017 .Detalhes documentados de sua Biografia Profissional podem ser acessados em sua página do facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/luiz.c.botelho/ )
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Matemática from Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (1979), master's at Mathematics from Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (1981) and doctorate at Physic from Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas (1985). Has experience in Physics, focusing on Physics of Elementary Particles and Fields, acting on the following subjects: path integral, loop space, q.c.d., wave equation and quantum geometry.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Muitos dos meus artigos elencados neste CV Lattes foram resenhados posteriormentee positivamente pelas altamente prestigiosas Mathematical Review (USA ) e Zentral Blat (Alemanha) .

published
by the author. The article is clearly motivated, the general context for the

International Journal of Modern Physics BVol. 20, No. 08, pp. 969-1003 (2006) Research PapersNo Access
SOME NON-PERTURBATIVE PATH INTEGRALS STUDIES IN STATISTICAL BURGER TURBULENCE: STRINGS AND STOCHASTIC INSTANTONS CONFIGURATIONS

LUIZ C. L. BOTELHO
https://doi.org/10.1142/S0217979206033474Cited by:0
Previous
Next

 View article

 Tools
 Share

Abstract

In this paper, we study Burger turbulence and the appearance of spatial coherent string dynamics structures for the statistical averaged vortex phase factor in a path integral framework. This result gives a strong mathematical method support to the unsolved long-standing Landau 1941's conjecture that in a turbulent field the flow vorticity should be confined to a limited region.

Additionally, we present the exact instanton path-integral solubility ? from a stochastic point of view ? of a fluid flow bounded by a moving string (random) boundary together with a study of another exact path-integral solubility of a weakly stirred complete Navier?Stokes flow.
Keywords:

 Path integralBurger turbulenceLandau conjecturevortex phase factor

This book is devoted to the large class of mathematical problems arising in the contemporary
physics and at the same time it presents a unique, modern treatment of
solutions to fractional random differential equations in different fields of the Mathematical
Physics. The functional analysis is the basic tool and a powerful method in the area
of the qualitative theory of differential equations. There are eleven chapters in which
different topics are considered. The first one is devoted to the Potential Theory and
analysis of the Laplace differential operator used in different problems of the Mathematical
Physics. The author consider the Dirichlet problem in connected planar region
and conformal transformation method for Green functions applied in String Theory.
The Scattering Theory for non-relativistic one-body short-range Quantum Mechanics
is considered in Chapter 2. Hilbert spaces and wave physics are investigated in Chapter
3. Chapter 4 and Chapter 7 are devoted to nonlinear diffusion, turbulence and
path-integral study. Functional integrals are investigated in chapters 5, 6 and 10. The
author follows an analytic approach in applied functional analysis for functional integration
in quantum field theory and stochastic Langeven-turbulent partial differential
equations. The ergodic theory is considered in both chapters 8 and 9. The Chapter 11
is devoted to the Atiyah-Singer index theorem. This chapter starts with notes on the
Dirac-type operators in Riemannian manifolds. There is a simple explanation of the
Atiyah-Singer index theorem. It states that the trace of the evolution operator associated
to a certain class of Dirac operators defined in two dimensional orientable compact

Lecture Notes in Topics in Path Integrals and String Representations
By (author): Luiz C L Botelho (Federal Fluminense University, Brazil)



 About This Book 

Functional Integrals is a well-established method in mathematical physics, especially those mathematical methods used in modern non-perturbative quantum field theory and string theory. This book presents a unique, original and modern treatment of strings representations on Bosonic Quantum Chromodynamics and Bosonization theory on 2d Gauge Field Models, besides of rigorous mathematical studies on the analytical regularization scheme on Euclidean quantum field path integrals and stochastic quantum field theory. It follows an analytic approach based on Loop space techniques, functional determinant exact evaluations and exactly solubility of four dimensional QCD loop wave equations through Elfin Botelho fermionic extrinsic self avoiding string path integrals.

Contents:

 Bosonic Free Strings and Non-Supersymetric QCD(SU(∞)): A Constant Gauge Field Path Integral Study
 Basics Polyakov's Quantum Surface Theory on the Formalism of Functional Integrals and Applications
 Critical String Wave Equations and the QCD(U(Nc)) String
 The Formalism of String Functional Integrals for the Evaluation of the Interquark Potential and Non Critical Strings Scattering Amplitudes
 The D → -∞ Saddle-Point Spectrum Analysis of the Open Bosonic Polyakov String in RD x SO(N) ? The QCD(SU(∞)) String

We present a simple Partial Differential Equation proof for the Atiyah-Singer
Index Theorem in the context of Dirac Operators on a Riemman Surface. Addintionaly,
we present a proof of the monotonic grown under the Ricci flux of the Dirac
Operator in the presence of a abelian Gauge Connection in a Riemman Surface.

BotelhoDepartamento de Matem ́atica Aplicada,Instituto de Matem ́atica, Universidade Federal Fluminense,Rua Mario Santos Braga24220-140, Niter ́oi, Rio de Janeiro, Brazile-mail: botelho.luiz@ig.com.brAbstractWe present an equivalent conjecture to the original Riemann?s conjecture on thelocalization on the Complex Plane of the zeros of the Zeta Function. This newproposed conjecture is hoped to be more monagable for a classical complex variableanalysis for thislong standing one century and half unsolved mathematical problem,besides of being a potential clue for the reason of why Riemann was naturally led tohis conjecture - a historical gap in the history of the Riemann?s conjecture.Key-words:Zeta function; Riemman conjecture
